articles.name: Prevent - Analytics Dashboard
articles.title: Prevent - Analytics Dashboard
articles.body:
Prevent analytics allows admins to access top-level statistics and data for their organization. This feature lets admins explore these data points to examine an overview of each email event.

Note:By selecting the navigation menu at the top-left corner of the page, you can navigate to other KnowBe4 products, including Defend, PhishER, and KSAT. For more information, see our Login Page and Navigation Menu Overview article.

Dashboard Data

The Prevent dashboard displays an overview of every analyzed email, focusing on those emails where Prevent has driven end-users to change their behavior, whether updating, removing, or replacing recipients or sensitive content. The dashboard will link to a search emails page and apply relevant filters based on what you select, allowing you to conduct a more granular analysis.

The data displayed on the initial dashboard aggregates the key Prevent use cases presented in the security center. The pie chart summarizes breach types, including:

  • Aggregated potential breaches prevented, and a percentage increase or decrease indicator
  • Aggregated potential breaches prevented for the preceding date period for comparison
  • Misdirected emails prevented by users accepting Prevent advice
  • Misspelled emails prevented by users accepting Prevent advice
  • Data exfiltration emails prevented by users accepting Prevent advice
  • Large recipient emails prevented by users accepting Prevent advice
  • Data loss events (DLP) prevented by users accepting Prevent advice
  • Misdirected content, including content analysis, events prevented by users accepting Prevent advice
  • New recipient emails prevented by users accepting Prevent advice
  • No or partial TLS emails prevented by users accepting Prevent advice
  • Multi-domain emails prevented by users accepting Prevent advice

Potential Breaches Prevented

This chart displays the number of potential breach events that contain at least one external recipient, allowing you to filter those emails easily. Clicking on any slice of the chart allows you to view a description of that statistic.

Silenced Prompts

This card displays the Prevent use cases you have chosen not to prompt users with Prevent advice about. These use cases are still being silently monitored. This feature can help you monitor the areas for which you may wish to configure prompting in the future.

Data Loss Prevention (DLP)

Note:Data Loss Prevention (DLP) is included as part of the Prevent Enterprise offering.

This section displays a high-level overview of the statistics relating to any data matching for content analysis, misdirected content, or DLP policies your organization has configured can be viewed. The following data is displayed:

  • Total number of DLP policies triggered for the given time period
  • All data matches by type, identified during the given time period
  • List of triggered DLP policies for the given time period

Clicking on any of these data points will take you to a filtered list of emails triggering those policies or matching those data types. 

Date Filtering

The date drop-down menu in the top-right corner of the screen allows you to view data for the previous:

  • Day
  • Week
  • Month
  • Quarter
  • Year
  • Custom Range

Data Retention

The retention period for Prevent Analytics is 18 months, plus a rolling 30 days. This data is required to improve the accuracy of the Prevent services and provide trend and risk analysis for reporting.

articles.name: Prevent - Network Configuration
articles.title: Prevent - Network Configuration
articles.body:
Prevent requires specific network configurations to function optimally. A crucial aspect of this functionality is ensuring that Prevent can communicate effectively with its required services without being hindered by security measures such as SSL inspection or decryption. If these services are being used, you can avoid potential issues by adding exceptions to bypass the regional URLs listed below.

Region URLs
United Kingdom
  • switch.egress.com
  • uk.intelligence.egress.com
Europe
  • eu1.esi.egress.com
  • eu.intelligence.egress.com
North America
  • us1.esi.egress.com
  • us.intelligence.egress.com
Asia-Pacific
  • au.esi.egress.com
  • au.intelligence.egress.com

articles.name: Prevent - How to Search Outbound Emails
articles.title: Prevent - How to Search Outbound Emails
articles.body:
The Search Emails page allows admins to find and investigate email events. Admins can use a range of filters to find the emails for their specific analysis.

The filters available include:

  • External recipients
    • View any emails that contain at least one external recipient, such as a recipient from a third-party or webmail address
  • Add-in
    • View events sent from a Microsoft Outlook add-in or the gateway
  • Attachments
    • View emails that contain at least one attachment
  • Advice type
    • View any combination of Prevent nudge types
  • Advice response
    • View any combination of user responses to Prevent nudges

The results table dynamically updates when any combination of filters is selected or deselected.

Search Results

The search results returned include:

  • Email details
    • Time and date stamp of when the email was sent
    • Subject: only displayed if you have chosen to sync this data with Prevent)
    • Sender and recipients
    • External or Internal
    • Sent from: add-in or gateway
  • Outcome
    • If the end-user was nudged with advice from Prevent: Yes or No
    • Which Prevent nudge was provided, and what the user's response was
  • Impact
    • If the email contained an attachment: Yes or No
    • All the data types identified in that email

Email Details

To see more granular information about a specific email, select it to view the Email Details tab.

More details about the specific findings of the email will be displayed in this tab. The unique Message ID can be copied and used to investigate the contents of an email further.

The following cards will be displayed, allowing you to view more information:

  • Event Summary
    • A high-level overview of the email, including time of sending, attachments, recipients, and the Prevent nudge type and nudge response.
  • Information
    • Contextual data or data matches relating to the email, such as content type matches detected and if any Data Loss Prevention (DLP) policies were triggered by the email.
  • Prevent-specific advice
    • This card details specific nudges and admin responses, including content analysis details and a recipient change log consisting of an itemized list of flagged recipients and whether the sender has removed them from the email.

articles.name: Prevent - Data Storage
articles.title: Prevent - Data Storage
articles.body:
Prevent is designed to protect sensitive information from unauthorized disclosure. An essential aspect of this system is how data is stored and handled. This article provides an overview of the type of data Prevent stores and how it is managed.

The data stored by Prevent falls into two categories:

System Data Application Data
Request duration Recipients
Request source geography Sender
Uncaught errors Sent time
HTTP response status codes Message ID
Azure host-level metrics Hashed pattern matches
Application level activity: database connections and outbound API calls Azure AD (Field: isEnabled)
Subject line*
Attachment names *

* This category is optional and can be used to display this information in the Prevent dashboard

Data sources are logically isolated from the Prevent infrastructure, and all activity between the application and its underlying data sources takes place over a secure connection using TLS 1.2.

Each organization's data is isolated by assigning each organization an ID. Authentication and database queries to Prevent are made at an organizational level, ensuring that data cannot be accessed between organizations.

articles.name: Prevent - Ingestion
articles.title: Prevent - Ingestion
articles.body:
In order for Prevent to provide the most value, a baseline dataset and an understanding of email relationships are required. This data is acquired through ingestion.

Important notes about ingestion:

  • Prevent ingests 12 months of metadata, if available
  • Ingestion is only possible for organizations using Microsoft Exchange Online
  • For shared mailbox support, ingestion is required to ensure users receive real-time Prevent advice when sending from a shared mailbox or on behalf of another user

The mandatory fields for the ingestion are:

  • Time - DateTime, UTC
  • Sender - String, sender's SMTP address
  • From - String, From: SMTP address if different from the sender
  • MessageID - String, Internet Message-ID header value
  • Recipients - list of recipients' addresses, as either a string or semicolon-separated string
  • Subject line
  • Attachment names

articles.name: Prevent - Shared Mailbox Support
articles.title: Prevent - Shared Mailbox Support
articles.body:
Prevent has released improved functionality to allow on-send advice when sending from shared mailboxes.

Overview

Previously, Prevent could only provide real-time advice to single mailboxes. When users sent emails from a shared mailbox, the emails were sent to the gateway for analysis, and users received a bounce back containing any suitable advice. This process is now changing, and our shared mailbox client support will allow a consistent Prevent experience for users regardless of whether they are sending from their own or a shared mailbox.

To ensure your organization has more Prevent coverage and a consistent user experience, users sending from a shared mailbox will receive real-time Prevent advice. This feature includes sending emails on behalf of other users when the Microsoft Outlook Add-in is installed.

When an email is sent from a shared mailbox, and the user triggers Prevent advice, we will continue to capture and display that event in the Prevent dashboard. Prevent admins will be able to search and view those emails sent from a shared mailbox as they would a regular email sent with Prevent advice.

Requirements

This feature is available to customers who:

  • Use Microsoft 365
  • Have ingested data into Prevent

These requirements allow advice for shared mailboxes to function while maintaining users' data security.

This feature is automatically available to those who meet these requirements, and no action is needed.

articles.name: AIDA Orchestration Guide
articles.title: AIDA Orchestration Guide
articles.body:
AIDA Orchestration is an always-on, AI-driven system that automatically manages and personalizes your Phishing Security Tests (PSTs) and security awareness training (SAT) to reduce user risk. AIDA uses AI to generate phishing templates and automatically sends phishing tests to users.

Even with this system enabled, you will retain full control to fine-tune the system's behavior and monitor all activity.

Enabling AIDA Orchestration

To enable AIDA Orchestration, log in to your KnowBe4 console and click the Orchestration tab.

Click the Enable Orchestration button. A confirmation window will pop up asking if you want to enable AIDA Orchestration. To continue, click the Continue button, and the General section of the AIDA Orchestration enablement page opens. If you don’t want to continue, click the Cancel button.

General Settings

Let’s get AIDA Orchestration working for you by creating a default plan that tells AIDA how to manage and personalize your team's phishing security tests and training.

What is a Plan?

A plan tells AIDA how to manage security awareness training for specific groups of users. Think of it as your blueprint for automation: you define who gets included, how often they receive phishing tests and training, then AIDA Orchestration handles the day-to-day execution.

Each Plan includes:

  • User groups you want to include and any you want to exclude
  • Phishing or Training frequency limits for phishing tests and security awareness training

Why use multiple Plans?

Different teams often need different approaches to security training. Plans let you customize AIDA Orchestration’s automation for each group's needs.

How Plans work together:

When you have multiple plans, they follow a priority order you set. If a user appears in multiple groups across different plans, AIDA Orchestration applies the plan with the highest precedence to that user. This feature prevents conflicts and ensures consistent training delivery.

To learn more about the options in this section, see the screenshot and the list below:

  1. Plan Enabled: This toggle is already enabled.
    Note: This toggle does not immediately enable AIDA Orchestration. It will be enabled only after you click the Save Changes button.
  2. Plan Name: This is the name for the default plan, and the admin cannot change it.
  3. Groups Included: Select the groups you want to include in the plan. For more information on managing users and groups, see the Users and Groups Management Guide.
  4. Groups Excluded: Select the groups you would like excluded from the plan.

Phishing Settings

To learn more about the options in this section, see the screenshot and the description below:

Phishing Test Frequency: Select how often you would like phishing tests sent to users. We recommend the AIDA selected option, in which AIDA will decide the frequency of phishing tests on a user-by-user basis.

Training Settings

To learn more about the options in this section, see the screenshot and the description below:

Training Frequency: Select how often you would like security awareness training sent to users. We recommend the AIDA selected option, in which AIDA will decide the frequency of training on a user-by-user basis.

Users

This section lists all user names, email addresses, and the assigned groups that will be included in your plan.

Managing AIDA Orchestration

To add a new plan, log in to your KnowBe4 console and click the Orchestration tab to see the Plans subtab of the AIDA Orchestration page.

To learn more about the options on this subtab, see the screenshot and the list below:

  1. Enable: Select this toggle to disable or enable AIDA Orchestration.
  2. + New Plan: Click this button to create a new plan. See the Adding a New Plan section below for more information.
  3. Unassigned Users: Click this button to view a list of users that have not been assigned to a group.
  4. Reorder Plans: Click this button to reorder the priority of where the plans are listed.
  5. Plan list: This section displays a list of the plans, the groups in each plan, and whether the plan is enabled or disabled.
  6. Actions: To enable the Actions column, click the three vertical dots icon on the far right side of the plan. Then, select one of the following actions:
    • Edit: Select this option to update the details of the plan.
    • Delete: Select this option to delete the plan.

Adding a New Plan

To add a new plan, click the +New Plan button. The Create Plan page opens. It has four sections: General, Phishing, Training, and Users.

General Settings

To learn more about the options in this section, see the screenshot and the list below:

  1. Plan Enabled: Select the toggle to enable or disable the plan.
    Note: This toggle does not immediately enable the plan. It marks it to be enabled. It will be enabled only after you click the Save button.
  2. Plan Name: Enter the name of your plan.
    Note: Default plans are named "Default" and cannot be changed by the admin.
  3. Groups Included: Select the groups you want to include in the plan. For more information on managing users and groups, see the Users and Groups Management Guide.
  4. Groups Excluded: Select the groups you would like excluded from the plan.

Phishing Settings

To learn more about the options in this section, see the screenshot and the description below:

Phishing Test Frequency: Select how often you would like phishing tests sent to users. We recommend the AIDA selected option, in which AIDA will decide the frequency of phishing tests on a user-by-user basis.

Training Settings

To learn more about the options in this section, see the screenshot and the description below:

Training Frequency: Select how often you would like security awareness training sent to users. We recommend the AIDA selected option, in which AIDA will decide the frequency of training on a user-by-user basis.

Users

This section lists all user names, email addresses, and the assigned groups that will be included in your plan.

When you are satisfied with your selections in each section, click the Save button at the bottom-left corner of the page.

Editing and Deleting a Plan

To edit a plan, click the three dots icon under Actions, select Edit from the drop-down list, and make any necessary updates. To delete the plan, select Delete.

Adding and Managing Training Notifications

To add a training notification, log in to your KnowBe4 console, click the Orchestration tab, and then the + Add Notification button on the Training Notifications subtab. Below is an overview of the notification options. For more details on this section, see our Training Campaign Notifications Overview article.

  1. Notification Type: From this drop-down menu, select when the notification will be sent. You can select from the following options: Welcome, Remind After Enrollment, Remind Before Due Date, Campaign Completion, or Past Due.
  2. Select Recipients and Templates: Select the appropriate check box to send notifications to your desired recipients. You can select from the following options: User, Manager, Admin, or a combination of these three options.
  3. Select Template: From the drop-down menu, select which notification template to send to the recipient type. To preview the selected template, click the eye icon on the right side of the field.
    Note: If you have enabled password-less logins in your account settings, be sure to select the training notifications labeled "(Password-less).'
  4. Manage Training Notification Templates: Click this link to view available notification templates in a new window. We provide several system email templates for you to choose from. You can click this option to customize our notifications or create your own notifications.

When you are satisfied with your notification selections, click the Save button.

Managing Training Notifications

To learn more about the options in this section, see the screenshot and the list below:

  1. +Add Notification: Click this button to add another notification.
  2. Edit: Click this button to edit a notification.
  3. Delete: Click this button to delete a notification.
  4. Update Notifications: if you have added, edited, or deleted a notification, click this button to confirm the update to your training notifications.

Viewing the Phishing Report

To learn more about the options in this section, see the screenshot and the list below:

  1. Arrow icon: Click this icon in the column headers to sort the results in the table.
  2. Phishing Test Details: Click the expand icon next to a user's email to see the reasoning behind the phishing test that was sent to the user.
  3. Generate CSV: Click this button to generate a CSV file version of the report table.

Viewing the Training Report

To learn more about the options in this section, see the screenshot and the list below:

  1. Arrow icon: Click this icon in the column headers to sort the results in the table.
  2. Training Details: Click the expand icon next to a user’s email to see the details on the training that was assigned.
  3. Generate CSV: Click this button to generate a CSV file version of the report table.
    Actions: To enable the Actions column, select one or more check boxes next to the user name. Then, select one of the following actions:
    • Mark as Completed: Mark the user's assigned content as completed.
    • Reset Progress: Reset any progress the user made on the assigned content.
    • Remove Assignment: Remove the assigned remedial training module for the user.

articles.name: Artificial Intelligence Defense Agents (AIDA) Change Log
articles.title: Artificial Intelligence Defense Agents (AIDA) Change Log
articles.body:
Use this article to stay up-to-date with changes to KnowBe4's Artificial Intelligence Defense Agents.

Note: Changes may include new, updated, deprecated, or removed features. KnowBe4 reserves the right to terminate access to, use of, and support of features that are included as part of the Subscription Services, which is common with SaaS services as they are constantly changing and improving. This allows us to adapt to the evolving cybersecurity industry so we can provide current, high-quality services.

See the table below for a list of updates, with the latest updates displayed at the top.

Release Date Description
October 2025
  • October 23, 2025 - We're excited to announce that AIDA Orchestration is now available as a technical preview. AIDA Orchestration represents the next evolution of our AI-driven security awareness platform, designed to automate and optimize your security awareness training intelligently. For more information, see the AIDA Orchestration Technical Preview article.
March 2025
  • March 27, 2025—We've added the Recommended Landing Pages agent to AIDA. This agent automatically suggests a landing page with your AIDA-generated phishing templates, or you can manually select a preferred landing page when editing your templates. For more information, see the Viewing and Editing Your Phishing Template section of the AIDA Template Generation Guide.
February 2025
  • February 26, 2025 - We've made a few updates to the AIDA Training Report. You can now include archived user data in the report and apply new filters to your search results. In addition, you can view phishing failure details for each user, such as the reason for the assigned training and which phishing template the user failed. For more information, see the Reviewing AIDA Remedial Training Results section of the AIDA Automated Training Guide.
  • February 11, 2025 - The ModStore page now includes a Knowledge Refresher filter under the Content Features drop-down menu. This filter is available only with an active AIDA add-on subscription.
  • February 3, 2025 - The Training page now includes AIDA Knowledge Refreshers if the AIDA add-on is part of your subscription. AIDA Policy Quizzes are also compatible with the KnowBe4 Learner App with an active subscription. in addition, three new badges are available for Knowledge Refreshers and Policy Quizzes. We also fixed a problem where the time shown for finishing a module differed on the console and mobile app versions, and now both versions display the same time. For more information, see the AIDA Knowledge Refreshers Guide and Learner Support: Badges Guide.
January 2025
  • January 30, 2025 - We've added the AIDA Callback Phishing Agent, which allows you to leverage generative AI to create custom callback phishing templates on demand based on your organization's specifications. This AIDA agent gives you the ability to better control the difficulty of your template by simply selecting the difficulty level of the template or by, more specifically, choosing the individual Social Engineering Indicators (SEI) in the template. For more information, please see our AIDA Template Generation Guide.
Release Date Description
November 2024
  • November 22, 2024 - We've released KnowBe4's Artificial Intelligence Defense Agents (AIDA), which offer a powerful AI-driven solution for managing human risk in your organization. AIDA helps reduce risk and improve user behavior through four key agents: AI-generated phishing templates, automated training, policy quizzes, and knowledge refreshers. For more information about AIDA, please see our Get Started with AIDA article.

articles.name: Integrate Tidal Cyber into Your KSAT Console
articles.title: Integrate Tidal Cyber into Your KSAT Console
articles.body:
You can integrate your Tidal Cyber platform into your KSAT console. Integrating Tidal Cyber into your KSAT console allows organizations to efficiently assess, organize, and optimize their cyber defenses based on a deep understanding of the threats and adversaries that are most relevant to them. Phishing Security Test (PST) activity can also be integrated into your Tidal Cyber platform.

Before You Connect Tidal Cyber to Your KSAT Console

Before integrating Tidal Cyber into your KSAT console, you must find your API address and create a Reporting Event API key. Follow the steps below to do both actions.

  1. Your API address depends on where your KnowBe4 account is located. Please see the table below to find the API address for your region.
    Region Base URL
    US

    https://us.api.knowbe4.com
    CA

    https://ca.api.knowbe4.com
    EU

    https://eu.api.knowbe4.com
    UK

    https://uk.api.knowbe4.com
    DE

    https://de.api.knowbe4.com
  2. Log in to your KSAT console as an admin.
  3. Navigate to Account Settings in the top-right corner under your account’s email address.
  4. In Account Settings, navigate to Account Integrations.
  5. Under Account Integrations, navigate to API > Reporting API.
  6. On the Reporting API tab, click the + Create New API Token button to open the API token creation screen.
  7. Enter a name for the token, then click Create Token.
  8. Please save this API token for the below steps.

Available Connections to Tidal Cyber

You can connect KnowBe4 Enterprise Security Training and KnowBe4 Simulated Phishing, also known as Phishing Security Tests, to Tidal Cyber. You can use the same API token to make both connections. 

Connecting Security Awareness Training to Tidal Cyber

The following KnowBe4 API Endpoint is used to enable this integration:

  • GET /v1/training/campaigns

You can connect your Tidal Cyber platform to your KSAT console by following the steps below.

Note:Only Tidal Cyber users with the admin role can enable and configure integrations.
  1. Navigate to Administration > Integration in the menu on the right side of the screen. Your current Active Connections, including KnowBe4, will appear in a table.
  2. Select the Available Integrations tab, select the KnowBe4 Enterprise Security Awareness Training product, and click Connect Integration.
  3. You should be prompted to Create KnowBe4 Connection.
  4. Under Select Integration Type(s), enter the information required for this integration. In this case, enter “Get Configuration”.
  5. Under API Details, add your API token and select your deployment region’s API address, as outlined in the earlier section.
  6. Select Create to save.
  7. The Active Connection table will now contain the KnowBe4 integration in the Enabled state and will run automatically.

To validate that your integration is working as expected in Tidal Cyber, add KnowBe4 to a defensive stack. After the KnowBe4 integration runs, check the defensive stack for capability toggle changes. You can also confirm the integration made changes by checking the exported integration logs.

Integrating Phishing Security Tests (PSTs) into Tidal Cyber

You can integrate KnowBe4 Phishing Security Test (PST) data into your Tidal Cyber platform. This action ensures users' Tidal Confidence Scores reflect their efforts to stay threat-informed.

You can follow the same steps outlined in the Before You Connect Tidal Cyber to Your KSAT Console and Connecting Tidal Cyber to Your KSAT Console sections above, except select the KnowBe4 Simulated Phishing product and use the following KnowBe4 API Endpoint to enable this integration:

  • GET /v1/phishing/security_tests

To validate your PSTs are connected to your Tidal Cyber platform:

  1. Navigate to the product registry page and find KnowBe4.
  2. When you click under the KnowBe4 product, you should see the capabilities listed. The source should be listed as INTEGRATION-KNOWBE4SP.

articles.name: Update to Nested App Authentication Single Sign-On (NAA-SSO) for the Phish Alert Button (PAB)
articles.title: Update to Nested App Authentication Single Sign-On (NAA-SSO) for the Phish Alert Button (PAB)
articles.body:
Microsoft has released Nested App Authentication, which allows for easier authentication and offers enhanced security and architectural flexibility compared to traditional full-trust and on-behalf-of authentication models. Because of this, Microsoft is deprecating legacy Exchange Online tokens starting on February 17, 2025. This means all Hybrid and Microsoft Ribbon Phish Alert Buttons (PABs) connected to Microsoft 365 domains will fail unless NAA-SSO is authorized. The legacy Exchange Online tokens can be reenabled until June 2025.

Due to these changes, we recommend authorizing Graph APIs and NAA-SSO in your Phish Alert account settings. For more information, see Microsoft’s Nested app authentication and Outlook legacy tokens deprecation FAQ.

Important:On February 25, 2025, we updated the fallback mechanism for the Microsoft Ribbon and Hybrid PABs. This updated manifest will allow the Microsoft Ribbon and Hybrid PABs to switch from NAA-SSO to SSO-OBO whenever it is in an environment that does not support NAA-SSO. You will need to update your XML manifest to implement the improved fallback mechanism.
Note:If you use the Microsoft Outlook (EXE Version) PAB, these changes will not affect your PAB usage.

Prerequisites for NAA-SSO

  • Microsoft 365, which requires Global Administrator role to accept permissions.
  • Exchange Online, which requires Global Administrator role to accept permissions.
  • Monthly Enterprise Channel Version 2409 or newer. Older versions will cause the Microsoft Ribbon PAB to time out.
  • Semi-Annual Channel Version 2408 or newer. Older versions will cause the Microsoft Ribbon PAB to time out.
  • Current Channel Version 2410 or newer.
Note: Safari and Firefox browsers may block the pop-up window when using the PAB in Outlook Web Access (OWA).

Additional Prerequisites

Important:Starting October 14, 2025, Outlook 2016, Outlook 2019, Exchange Server 2016, and Exchange Server 2019 will reach their lifecycle end dates with Microsoft and will no longer be supported.

NAA-SSO availability will vary depending on the version of Microsoft Office and Microsoft Outlook being used. To determine if your environment supports NAA-SSO, refer to Microsoft's Nested app auth requirement set article. Compatible versions include:

  • Microsoft Outlook on Windows (volume-licensed perpetual) Version 2408 (Build 17932.20222) or later.
  • Microsoft Outlook on Windows (retail perpetual) Version 2501 (Build 18429.20132) or later.

Important version notes:

  • Microsoft Office 2024 (volume-licensed perpetual) will support NAA-SSO.
  • Microsoft Office 2021 (volume-licensed perpetual) will still support SSO-OBO for authentication but not NAA-SSO.
  • Microsoft Office 2016 and 2019 (volume-licensed perpetual) will not support NAA-SSO or SSO-OBO authentication. For more information on Microsoft Office 2016 and 2019, see Microsoft's documentation.
  • Microsoft Outlook on Windows (retail perpetual) Version 2008 (Build 13127.20000) or later will support SSO-OBO authentication.
Note: Authenticating with SSO-OBO requires the Identity API v1.3. For more information see Microsoft's Identity API requirement sets article.
Remember:The error "Your mail server needs a valid authentication token" is caused by Microsoft deprecating legacy Exchange authentication tokens. To resolve this error, you must authorize Nested App Authentication - single sign-on (NAA-SSO).

Accepting Permissions for NAA-SSO

To accept permissions for the NAA-SSO with Microsoft, follow the steps below.

  1. Log in to your KSAT account and click on your email address in the top-right corner of the page.
  2. Select Account Settings, then navigate to Account Integrations > Phish Alert.
  3. Click the drop-down menu to expand your PAB settings.
  4. Scroll down and click Authorize NAA-SSO for GRAPH APIs. You’ll be redirected to a Microsoft 365 login page.
    Note: You’ll also need to click Accept Microsoft Permissions to Authorize GRAPH APIs for the PAB if those permissions haven’t been previously accepted.

  5. Log in to your Microsoft 365 account using your admin credentials.
  6. Once you log in, the Permissions requested pop-up window will display. Read the permissions, then click Accept.
    Note: If multiple PAB instances are deployed to different Microsoft 365 tenants, you must accept the permissions to Authorize Graph APIs and NAA-SSO for each PAB instance on each tenant.

  7. Once you accept the permissions, the GRAPH Authorization Successful window will display. It can take up to 48 hours after accepting the permissions for NAA-SSO to apply to your user's Microsoft Outlook profiles.

Internet Explorer NAA-SSO

If your organization uses Outlook on Microsoft Edge in Internet Explorer mode or Internet Explorer with Microsoft 365, you need to authorize permissions for Graph APIs and NAA-SSO for the PAB before June 2025 to avoid service interruption. Once permissions are authorized, you can disable legacy Exchange Online tokens and report an email with the PAB to ensure it works correctly.

Important:To use this feature, your organization must use Microsoft 365. This feature isn’t available for Exchange Online.

User Experience

Below is the user experience for Internet Explorer NAA-SSO:

  1. Click the PAB in the ribbon.

  2. It will load in the task pane and show a pop-up window.
  3. Users will need to log in to their Microsoft account the first time reporting with the PAB.

    Note:If users are unable to authenticate with NAA-SSO or SSO-OBO, the PAB will fall back to the interactive authentication mechanism that requires users to log in to Microsoft for the first time using the PAB.
  4. Click the Phish Alert button to report the email.

Troubleshooting

Note: If the issue you are experiencing is not listed in the troubleshooting steps below, contact support for assistance.

Question: Does this require me to redeploy the Phish Alert Button (PAB) XML manifest after authorizing NAA-SSO?

Answer: No, just accepting the permissions will be enough.

Question: I’m receiving the following error: "Your mail server needs a valid authentication token for the Phish Alert Button. If you need assistance with your mail server settings, please contact your admin." How can I resolve it?

Answer: This indicates that the PAB you’re using is trying to authenticate with the deprecated legacy Exchange Online token. Try the following steps to resolve the error:

  1. We recommend repeating steps 1-7 in the Accepting Permissions for NAA-SSO section above. If this does not resolve this issue, try redeploying the PAB by following steps 2 through 5 below.
  2. Uninstall the current PAB in your Microsoft 365 admin center by going to Settings > Integrated Apps > Add-ins.
  3. Find your PAB add-in in the list.
  4. Select the add-in and click Remove app.
  5. Reinstall the PAB manifest file. See our PAB installation guides for more information.
    Note:If you use the Hybrid PAB, we recommend updating the PAB XML manifest before removing and redeploying it. For more information, see our documentation on Updating and Uninstalling the Hybrid PAB.

Question: I'm receiving the following error: "We were unable to process this item. Please try again later." How can I resolve it?

Answer: Toggling on New Outlook should resolve this issue.

Question: What permission scopes does the Graph-enabled PAB use?

Answer: Here are the permission scopes used by the Graph-enabled PAB:

  • Mail.Read: This permission allows the PAB to read the user's email and is used to get email headers, attachments and the content of the email body.
  • Mail.Read.Shared: This permission allows the PAB to read the emails of shared mailbox users and is used to get email headers, attachments and the content of the email body.
  • Mail.ReadWrite: This permission allows the PAB to read and write user emails.
  • Mail.ReadWrite.Shared: This permission allows the PAB to read and write emails in shared mailboxes.
  • Mail.Send: This permission allows the PAB to send user emails.
  • Mail.Send.Shared: This permission allows the PAB to send emails from shared mailboxes, granted that the user has the send-as permission enabled for the shared mailbox.
  • openid: This permission allows the PAB to get basic information about the user.
  • profile: This permission allows the PAB to access the user’s profile information.

Question: Do I need to authorize Nested App Authentication Single Sign On (NAA-SSO) or Single Sign On On-Behalf-Of (SSO-OBO) for each type of PAB I use?

Answer: NAA-SSO and SSO-OBO authorizations are on a per Microsoft 365 tenant basis. This means that if you have NAA-SSO enabled for Hybrid PAB on your tenant, you don’t need to authorize it for the Microsoft Ribbon PAB or other types of PAB. This is the same for SSO-OBO.

Question: How do I check for the Microsoft Graph API permissions used by the PAB?

Answer: Using your Microsoft Entra portal, you can check the PAB's Microsoft Graph API permissions:

  1. Login to your Microsoft Entra admin center and navigate to Applications > Enterprise Applications.
  2. Filter out the PAB by typing in ‘phish alert’ on the filter input box.
  3. Then click on the Phish Alert button entry and check the details related to the Phish Alert button.

Question: What should I do if I enabled NAA-SSO, but the Hybrid PAB didn’t work for my environment?

Answer: Check if the PAB permissions were accepted for NAA-SSO and Graph APIs for the PAB. The permissions table will look similar to this:

If you’ve confirmed that the permissions have been accepted and the issue still isn’t resolved, contact our support team.

Question: How long do the permissions take to update once accepted?

Answer: Permissions are updated almost instantly for browsers and new Outlook clients. However, for Windows Outlook clients, it might take some time to update. If you’re using a Windows Outlook client and your permissions are taking a while to update, we suggest deleting the WEF or cache folder of Windows Outlook.

Question: Will our users notice any difference once we authorize NAA-SSO?

Answer: The only difference users will see is that it may say Graph in the top right corner after they click the PAB to report an email.

articles.name: Defend - How to Implement a Mail Flow Rule to Skip Secure/Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (S/MIME) Emails
articles.title: Defend - How to Implement a Mail Flow Rule to Skip Secure/Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (S/MIME) Emails
articles.body:
This article guides you through creating a mail flow rule in Microsoft 365 to bypass Defend scanning for Secure/Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (S/MIME) encrypted emails. This rule is required because S/MIME emails are already encrypted. As a result, our Defend system cannot scan or process the contents of these emails for security purposes. The preexisting encryption prevents any further analysis or modification by Defend.

Prerequisites

The only prerequisite for bypassing Defend scanning is to have admin access to Microsoft 365.

Instructions

Follow the steps below to bypass Defend scanning:

  1. Log in to the Microsoft Admin Center.
  2. In the left sidebar, navigate to Show All > Admin Centers > Exchange.
  3. In the Exchange admin center, navigate to Mail flow > Rules > + > Create a new rule. 
  4. Configure the rule by filling out the fields as shown in the screenshot and list below:
    1. Rule name: Enter a descriptive name, such as "Skip S/MIME Emails for Defend". 
    2. Rule conditions: Under Apply this rule if..., select The message properties > Include any of these words in the message header. In the Specify words or phrases dialog box, enter"Words=Content-Type" and "matches=application/pkcs7-mime". Under Do the following... select Modify the message properties > Set a message header. Enter the header name as "X-Egress-Defend-Bypass-SMIME" and set the header value to true.
    3. Except if: Under Except if..., add any necessary exceptions. This step is optional.
    4. Rule settings: Set the rule priority to run before the Defend mail flow rules and select Stop processing more rules.

articles.name: Integrate CYE’s Hyver with Your KSAT Console
articles.title: Integrate CYE’s Hyver with Your KSAT Console
articles.body:
You can integrate your CYE Hyver platform into your KSAT console. Hyver is CYE’s Cyber Risk Quantification Platform. Integrating Hyver into your KSAT console allows you to create findings based on data from phishing simulation outcomes and compliance gaps discovered during KnowBe4’s security awareness training in your organization.

Before You Connect Hyver to Your KSAT Console

Before integrating CYE’s Hyver into your KSAT console, you must find your API address and create a Reporting Event API key. Follow the steps below to do both actions.

  1. Your API address depends on where your KnowBe4 account is located. Please see the table below to find the API address for your region.
    Region Base URL
    US https://us.api.knowbe4.com
    CA https://ca.api.knowbe4.com
    EU https://eu.api.knowbe4.com
    UK https://uk.api.knowbe4.com
    DE https://de.api.knowbe4.com
  2. Log in to your KSAT console as an admin.
  3. Navigate to Account Settings in the top-right corner under your account’s email address.
  4. In Account Settings, navigate to Account Integrations.
  5. Under Account Integrations, navigate to API > Reporting API.
  6. On the Reporting API tab, click the + Create New API Token button to open the API token creation screen.
  7. Enter a name for the token, then click Create Token.
  8. Please save this API token for the below steps.

Connecting Hyver to Your KSAT Console

You can connect your Hyver platform to your KSAT console by following the steps below.

  1. Log in to your Hyver platform as an admin.
  2. Navigate to Settings > Integrations.
  3. Select the KnowBe4 tile.
  4. Enter the name for the integration.
  5. Under Authentication, enter your API address from the previous steps to the Base URL field. For example, if your KSAT account is located in the US, you would use "https://us.api.knowbe4.com".
  6. Enter the Reporting API token generated in the previous steps to the API key field.
  7. Click the Test connection button to verify that your Hyver platform can connect to the KSAT console.
  8. Click Save to save the configuration or Cancel to skip saving. When you click Save, Hyver will automatically test the connection to KSAT.

When you click Save, Hyver initiates a data synchronization with KSAT. Findings are populated in Hyver, and an engagement named Integrations with external tools is created. You can view this data on Hyver’s Findings page.

  • October 16, 2024 - We've released our KSAT Graph APIs! Our KSAT Graph APIs allow you to utilize complex queries and mutations to perform most functions of the supported KnowBe4 products via API. For more information, see our KSAT Graph API documentation.
August 2024
  • August 26, 2024 - We've updated our reporting APIs to allow you to return the store purchase ID for each training enrollment, to exclude the ‘completion_percentage' field from the response to greatly speed up response time, and to return a specific employee number. For more information, see the Training section of our Reporting API documentation.
April 2024
  • We've updated our reporting APIs to include a query parameter for returning the campaign ID for training enrollments. For more information, see the Training section of our KSAT Reporting APIs documentation.
January 2024
  • We've updated our reporting APIs to include queries for callback phishing campaigns on our phishing endpoints. For more information, see the Phishing section of our KSAT Reporting APIs documentation.
Release Date Description
October 2023
  • We've made security improvements for our User Event, Product, and Reporting APIs. Now API tokens will be visible only when they are first created. Afterward, only the last 10 digits of the API tokens will be visible in the KSAT console. For the Reporting API, we've also added support for multiple tokens. For more information, see our KnowBe4's User Event API, KnowBe4's Product API, and KnowBe4's Reporting API articles.
August 2023
  • We've added an Egress integration to the KSAT console. This integration allows you to send your KSAT data to Egress to help you prepare for phishing attacks and data breaches. For more information, see Egress's KnowBe4 integration documentation.
  • We've added the new Enable Webhook Failure Notifications check box for webhooks! This option sends recipients an email notification when a webhook receives 50 percent of the allowed failed responses in an hour. A second notification will be sent if the webhook exceeds the allowed number of failed responses in an hour and is deactivated. For more information, see our Webhooks in Your KSAT Console article.
  • We've added course durations to users' training certificates! The duration is the estimated time needed to complete the course. For more information, see our How to Download or Print Your Training Certificate article.
  • We've added the ability to preview how your executive reports will look as a PDF file! While previewing a report, you'll have the option to adjust your widgets as needed. For more information, see our KSAT Executive Reports Overview article.
  • For information about the latest ModStore content releases, visit our ModStore Content Releases article.
June 2023
  • We've fixed a bug that was causing some API endpoints to incorrectly return a 200 success with a payload of [] when an invalid ID was used. Now the affected API endpoints will return the correct 404 error, which states that the resource was invalid and could not be found.
Release Date Description
November 2022
  • We've added a webhook API for your phishing and training events. You can use this feature to send real-time data to the other applications you use. For more information, see our How to Create Webhooks in Your KSAT Console article.

  • Phishing endpoints:

    • The modules array will be removed. Training module data will still be available in the content array.
  • Users, Groups, and Phishing Recipient endpoints:
    • The current adi_guid and active_directory_guid field names will be updated to provisioning_guid. The current adi_manageable field name will be updated to provisioning_managed.
  • Users and Groups endpoints:
    • The current group_type value for a provisioning-managed group will be updated from adi_managed_group to provisioning_managed_group. On November 3rd, we made the following updates to our Reporting API:
October 2021

  • We have updated our Reporting API to include new Risk Score History endpoints for Account, Users, and Groups. For more information, see our API Documentation.
September 2021
  • We added a new burst limit to our APIs. The burst limits are 50 requests per minute and will start around five minutes from the first API request. For more information, see our API Documentation.
  • We have improved the way that our API results are returned. The returned results are now listed in sequence with the request's response when the per_page parameters and page numbers are the same. For more information, see our API Documentation.
  • We created a Cybersecurity Awareness Month video series with tips on how to develop and improve your organization's security awareness program. To watch these videos, see our How to Develop a Successful Security Awareness Program article.
  • The Training Status by Campaign report received two new columns, Campaign Started and Campaign Complete.
  • Under Reporting, the column labeled Failed % has been changed to Clicked % to better reflect your reporting data. This change will apply to the Reporting interface as well as downloaded PDF and CSV files.
  • You can now save reports to be viewed at a later time or send saved reports to other users. You can also choose to schedule reports to be generated and sent at a set frequency. For more information, see our How to Save and Send Reports guide.
  • When creating or editing an email template under My Templates, you can now indicate what language that template was written in. Custom templates with a language selected can then be used in localized phishing campaigns. See our Localization Guide for more information.
  • We have created the new ASAP Profile page, which lists the information used to generate your program. Your ASAP Profile includes organizational information and the responses provided when your ASAP questionnaire was originally completed.
